result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Terrance Toran Burt Jr

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Terrance Toran Burt Jr in court.  Attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for status conference.  
Defendant informed the court he has pending matters (22CF3448 & 22CF2099) in Branch 40 and SPD has not appointed counsel yet. 
Case adjourned to Branch 13. 
Parties are advised that effective 10/31/2022, pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-17, this case will be reassigned to Branch 37, Judge Dee in Room 515 of the Courthouse.
Status conference scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Supervision Report, filed.

Defendant Terrance Toran Burt Jr in court.  Prosecuting attorney Samuel Tyler Tabin in court for the State of Wisconsin. Pretrial conference held. SPD has not yet appointed counsel. Case is adjourned in Branch 13.
Status conference scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no contact with JNN, alleged witness referred to and identified by the defendant; CRP, alleged witness referred to and identified by the defendant
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  No driving without a valid license and insurance.

Defendant Terrance Toran Burt Jr appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Sylvan Jaspen appeared by video for Terrance Toran Burt Jr.  Attorney Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 13.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned to Branch 13.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
